title: Spider-Man[2002]5.1-Rifftrax.4K.1080p.BR.x264-KmCrct
description:
Sam Raimi's first Spider-Man flick. The film was encoded from the 4K Blu-Ray @ 2MBPS in full frame 1080p. Sharpness has been increased. I have compared the picture to some other 4K versions and it is sharper with smaller file size. 
Their are three audio tracks. The default is 5.1 AC3 Rifftrax by Mike, Kevin and Bill. The film audio is ducked so that you can always hear the comments but is ducked in such a way that you can't hear any volume change what is referred to as pumping. Half the reason I do these encodes is because I detest the volume pumping in other versions. It's super annoying to watch a film where the volume is constantly changing. The disembaudio que lines have been removed.
The second audio is 5.1 AC3 original film audio it has been boosted and cleaned. The third audio is 2.0 MP3 version of the Rifftrax with the que lines and no ducking. 
Images include film posters and folder icons. right click any of the three folders and choose customize and change folder icon. Browse to the images folder and choose the icon you like for that folder. 
SUBtitles are mostly SRT. There are 30 Subs. Some are in-sync and some are not. I left them standalone so that you may edit them as necessary. It is way to tedious to sync all these subs.
